newsitem.title: UK: Luxembourg declared flag of convenience - union.
newsitem.headline: Luxembourg declared flag of convenience - union.

text.p: The Luxembourg shipping register has been declared a flag of convenience and will face boycott action by the International Transport Workers' Federation (ITF).
"Luxembourg has now been added to the list of registers considered to be flags of convenience," said Mark Dickinson, assistant general secretary of the ITF, which has five million members
"We have already begun the process of selecting targets and from Sunday September 1 these ships are open for action by our affiliates world-wide," added Dickinson.

The London-based ITF is campaigning to eliminate flag of conveniences and get shipowners to register with national flags. The term flag of convenience refers to ships flying the flag which is not the national flag of the the country of the owner.

The ITF says FOC registers tend to have more substandard ships and poorer wages than national registers. The Federation allows agreements to be drawn up between its affliates and FOCs which gives the crew protection against abuses by owners and helps maintain standard of safety on the ship.
